verbs.description: consecute (third-person singular simple present consecutes, present participle consecuting, simple past and past participle consecuted)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To follow closely; to endeavour to overtake; to pursue.
examples: For, as ferr as I can lerne, few men hitherto, being here in any auctoritie, hath finally consecuted favors and thankes, but rather the contrarie, with povertie for theire farewell.
